title: ECB Launches Fresh Stimulus Programme
text:
PSG Wealth Daily Investment Update, 13 September 2019

The JSE pushed higher on Thursday after the European Central Bank (ECB) slashed interest rates and vowed to boost economic activity. Shortly after the closing bell, the All Share was up by 0.96%.US stocks traded higher on Thursday after Washington backtracked tariff hikes on Chinese goods, easing trade tensions. The was up by 0.46% shortly after the JSE closed.European shares surged on Thursday after the ECB undertook to boost economic activity, cutting interest rates by 10 basis points. Shortly after the JSE closed, the was up 0.10%, 40 rose to 0.44% and 30 ended 0.41% in the green.Hong Kong stocks wobbled on Thursday but were on track for weekly gains amid easing trade tensions. The closed 0.17% in the red.Signs of cooling trade tensions between the US and China lifted Japanese shares on Thursday with the reaching its highest levels since October 2018. The Nikkei Index closed 0.75% in the green.The rand strengthened to a six-week high on Thursday afternoon as investors cheered the ECB’s decision to cut interest rates. Just after the JSE closed, the rand weakened to R14.59/$.Improved risk appetite boosted by cheers of economic stimulus from ECB continued to lift the price of gold on Thursday after the central bank trimmed interest rates by 10 basis points. At 19h00, an ounce of traded at $1 498.13.Oil prices dropped on Thursday after OPEC decided to trim production output and US crude inventories declined to the lowest level in almost a year. At 19h15, a barrel of lost 1.79% and traded at $60.29.
